lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Oh, hello there.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: How did you get here, small friend?

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: That must have been a difficult journey.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: You must be so tired.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Please, come sit with me a while.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: It must have taken so much effort to get here.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Take some rest with me.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I would appreciate the company, in this lonely place.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: The view up here is so beautiful, would you not agree?

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: You can see every path that you have crossed in order to get here.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: What feelings does it inspire, now that you have made it?

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Whatever that feeling, I hope that it can bring you peace.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I think, my friend, that you should head toward the crest of the peak.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I am not sure why, but it seems as though that is your goal.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: But, good luck to you.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Why, it is my small friend again.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I see you have made it to visit me again.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I am so fortunate, this day.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: It was so rare to receive company, up here in this place.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: It makes me feel better to have a companion to speak with.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I always decide myself so lucky to have more of them.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Have you made many friends, in your travels to get here?

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Even if you cannot speak back, I am relieved.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Head to the crest, my friend.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: You have done so well.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: We meet again.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: It seems the Stars are in my favor again today.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: And yours, that you have made it all the way here.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: You know, Quingee make me very wary, but...

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: There is something about you, that does not put me at unease.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I am not sure why, but I am grateful.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: You have done well again today, my small friend.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I hope that you know that you have done well, too.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Thank you for visiting me, each time we cross paths.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: It is a long way up here.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Would you agree?

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I wonder what it is, that you thought about coming here.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: What you held onto, while you made the journey.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: The feelings, or the people, that you kept in your mind.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: In my climb today, I thought of my father.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I miss him.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Do you have your family, my small friend?

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Thank you for seeing me, once again.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: My small friend, will you sit with me?

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Today, I feel sad.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Did you know, that this peak is a graveyard?

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: But, my memory has failed with time, and...

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: I am unsure of which grave belongs to which person.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: It brings me pain, that I cannot visit each grave, as it is deserved.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: So, please, wish them each well for me.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Even if you do not know them, either.

lines.name: Oz
lines.text: Be brave, and have good fortune, my small friend.
You pay a visit to Oz and spend some time together before you head back on your journey.
